intro: Capparis laeta, commonly known as the sweet-scented caper, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Capparaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, green, edible buds that are often used in culinary applications. Its leaves are succulent and can be used in traditional medicine. Capparis laeta thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in coastal or sandy soils.
